definition: variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
bottle stopper/plug/(gun) bolt/(grenade) pin

sentences.english: 16A bolt drawn back and Walter welcomes me.
sentences.chinese: 16門栓拉開了，沃爾特把我讓進去。

sentences.english: He stretched himself on her threshold and uttered his complaints to the cruel bolts and bars .
sentences.chinese: 他匍伏在她門檻上對着冷酷無情的插銷門栓傾訴哀怨。

sentences.english: Moments later, the bolts of the enormous wooden portal began to move.
sentences.chinese: 過好一會兒，那巨大的木門的門栓開始鬆動。

sentences.english: The bolt gave way, and the door flung inward to reveal the two gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 門栓脫了位，門向內打開，露出裏面的兩個傢伙。

sentences.english: Rose-Red ran and pulled back the bolt, then flung open the door.
sentences.chinese: 紅玫瑰跑到門前把門栓拉開，接着把門打開了。
帶貫穿螺栓門栓的加固插銷。

sentences.english: Menshuan wolf just pulling up, then opened the door.
sentences.chinese: 狼剛拉起門栓，那門就開了。

definition: horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
